00097 #include "HashData.h"
00098 #include "HashTable.h"

00139 #define arg_READ4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opread
00140 #define res_READ4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opread
00141 
00142 int nfs4_op_read(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,
00143                    compound_data_t   * data,
00144                    struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00145 {
00146   char               funcname[] = "nfs4_op_read" ;
00147 
00148   fsal_seek_t            seek_descriptor ;
00149   fsal_size_t            size ;
00150   fsal_size_t            read_size;
00151   fsal_off_t             offset ;
00152   fsal_boolean_t         eof_met ;
00153   caddr_t                bufferdata ;
00154   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00155   cache_content_status_t content_status ;
00156   fsal_attrib_list_t     attr ;
00157   cache_entry_t        * entry = NULL ;
00158  
00159   cache_content_policy_data_t datapol ;
00160 
00161   datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = FALSE ;
00162  
00163   /* Say we are managing NFS4_OP_READ */
00164   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_READ ;
00165   res_READ4.status =  NFS4_OK ;
00166 
00167    /* If there is no FH */
00168     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00169       {
00170         res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00171         return  res_READ4.status ;
00172       }
00173   
00174     /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00175     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00176       {
00177         res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00178         return res_READ4.status ;
00179       }
00180     
00181     /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00182     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00183       {
00184         res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00185         return res_READ4.status ;
00186       }
00187  
00188  
00189     /* vnode to manage is the current one */
00190     entry = data->current_entry ;
00191     
00192     /* Only files can be read */
00193     if( data->current_filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00194       {
00195         /* If the source is no file, return EISDIR if it is a directory and EINAVL otherwise */
00196         if( data->current_filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || data->current_filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00197           res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_ISDIR ;
00198         else
00199           res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00200         
00201         return res_READ4.status ;
00202       }
00203     
00204     /* Get the size and offset of the read operation */    
00205     offset = arg_READ4.offset ;
00206     size   = arg_READ4.count ;
00207 
00208 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00209     printf( "   NFS4_OP_READ: offset = %llu  length = %llu\n", offset, size ) ;
00210 #endif
00211 
00212     if( ( data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD ) == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD )
00213      if( (fsal_off_t)(offset+size) > data->pexport->MaxOffsetRead )
00214       {
00215          res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_DQUOT ;
00216          return res_READ4.status ;
00217       }
00218  
00219     /* Do not read more than FATTR4_MAXREAD */
00220     if(  ( data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD ) &&
00221          size > data->pexport->MaxRead )
00222       {
00223         /* the client asked for too much data, 
00224          * this should normally not happen because 
00225          * client will get FATTR4_MAXREAD value at mount time */
00226         size = data->pexport->MaxRead ;
00227       }
00228     
00229     /* If size == 0 , no I/O is to be made and everything is alright */
00230     if( size == 0 )
00231       {
00232         res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.eof = FALSE ; /* end of file was not reached because READ occured, and a size = 0 can not lead to eof */
00233         res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.data.data_len = 0 ;
00234         res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.data.data_val = NULL ;
00235         
00236         res_READ4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00237         return  res_READ4.status ;
00238       }
00239     
00240    /* Deny read access to share read denied file */
00241    if( ( entry->object.file.pshare != NULL ) &&  ( entry->object.file.pshare->data.share.share_deny & OPEN4_SHARE_DENY_READ ) )
00242     {
00243           res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_LOCKED ;
00244           return res_READ4.status ;
00245     }
00246     
00247   if( ( data->pexport->options &  EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE ) &&
00248       ( entry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL ) )
00249     {
00250       /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it .
00251        * Several threads may call this function at the first time and a race condition can occur here
00252        * in order to avoid this, cache_inode_add_data_cache is "mutex protected" 
00253        * The first call will create the file content cache entry, the further will return
00254        * with error CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS which is not a pathological thing here */
00255       
00256       datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXCACHESIZE ;
00257       datapol.MaxCacheSize = data->pexport->MaxCacheSize ;
00258 
00259       /* Status is set in last argument */
00260       cache_inode_add_data_cache( entry, data->ht, data->pclient, data->pcontext, &cache_status ) ;
00261 
00262       if( ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) && 
00263           ( cache_content_cache_behaviour( entry, 
00264                                            &datapol,
00265                                            (cache_content_client_t *)(data->pclient->pcontent_client),
00266                                            &content_status ) == CACHE_CONTENT_FULLY_CACHED ) &&
00267           ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS ) )
00268         {
00269           res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00270           return res_READ4.status ;
00271         }
00272 
00273     }
00274   
00275     /* Some work is to be done */
00276     if( ( bufferdata = (char *)Mem_Alloc( size ) ) == NULL )
00277      {
00278        res_READ4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00279        return res_READ4.status ;
00280       }
00281     memset( (char *)bufferdata, 0, size )  ;
00282     
00283     seek_descriptor.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
00284     seek_descriptor.offset = offset ;
00285     
00286     if( cache_inode_rdwr( entry, 
00287                           CACHE_CONTENT_READ, 
00288                           &seek_descriptor,
00289                           size,
00290                           &read_size,
00291                           &attr,
00292                           bufferdata, 
00293                           &eof_met,
00294                           data->ht, 
00295                           data->pclient, 
00296                           data->pcontext, 
00297                           &cache_status )  != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00298       {
00299         res_READ4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00300         return res_READ4.status ;
00301       }
00302       
00303     /* What is the filesize ? */
00304     if( ( offset + read_size ) > attr.filesize )
00305       res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.eof = TRUE ;
00306     
00307     res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.data.data_len = read_size ;
00308     res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.data.data_val = bufferdata ;
00309   
00310 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4 
00311     printf( "   NFS4_OP_READ: offset = %llu  read length = %llu eof=%u\n", offset, read_size, eof_met ) ;
00312 #endif
00313 
00314     /* Is EOF met or not ? */
00315     if( eof_met == TRUE )
00316       res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.eof = TRUE ;
00317     else
00318       res_READ4.READ4res_u.resok4.eof = FALSE ;
00319  
00320     /* Say it is ok */
00321     res_READ4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00322     
00323     return res_READ4.status;
00324 } /* nfs4_op_read */
00325 
00326     
00337 void nfs4_op_read_Free( READ4res * resp )
00338 {
00339   if( resp->status == NFS4_OK )
00340     if(  resp->READ4res_u.resok4.data.data_len != 0 )
00341       Mem_Free(  resp->READ4res_u.resok4.data.data_val ) ;
00342   return ;
00343 } /* nfs4_op_read_Free */
Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:28 2008 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.3.9.1
